body.p: From information obtained from the clerk of the Casey Court it turns out that instead of a bond of $2400 which the Govr remitted for Osburn Bates & others the cases stand as follows on recognizances not on bonds

1 Commonwealth vs Wood Osburn & others= Mitchell Bates ^1^ Bates principal. Thomas ^2^ Bates, John ^3^ Osburn, David ^4^ Osburn John Fletcher ^5^ Fulcher & Achilles ^6^ Evans surities recognizances for $200 and three cases. Let your remission cover three forfeited recognizances ^of 200%$ each^ against the above six persons done at November term of the Casey Circuit Court -- stating Michell Bates as principal & others as suretites
2 One other remission covering Three forfeited recognizances of 200$ each taken at same 2 term & court against the same six except that Wood Osburn is principal isntead of Mitchell Bates.
3 One other remission for 3 recognizances same court & time & persons for 200 each with William Osburn principal

4 One other ^remission^ same persons & Three recog. of 200 each with Josiah Evans as principal. & the other sic as sureties
I would have you make out these four remissions of three in each, All filled up and ask the Governor to sign & then mail them to me at once as the court is close at hand
You observe it all amounts to 2400$ but not in the shape I had supposed & the remission sent will not do as there is a fatal misdescription
Pardon the miserable pen & material that I am compelled to use this morning.
My regards to the Governor with me as soon as you can.

Yours Truly
E L Van Winkle

Casey Cir Ct
Remit ^except^ fees & costs
Richard T. Jacob
Lt. & Act. Gov.
vs
Sundry persons
16th Apl/64
